title: Minutes
text:
Working Group Name and Logo

Discuss and finalize the name
Choose a Hex sticker image

Communication

Set up a Slack channel

Next Steps

Inviting collaborators
Discuss the upcoming manuscript
Decide whether to open a repository for BR specifications and chart creation






We decided to name the repository linked to our published paper ‘brcharts’. We also chose a logo, exploring color choices like red (for risk) and green (for benefit). Additionally, we’re considering a non-hexagonal shape for our group’s logo and plan to explore the CVD color palette for further inspiration.









Selected







Other candidate 1







Other candidate 2







Other candidate 3







Other candidate 4






Figure 1



- **Action**: Create brcharts logo

- **Due**: EOM

- **Assigned**: All

Slack Channel: A Slack channel has been created and members invited. The group will assess its efficiency after three months.

Action: Use channel
Due: Review channel - Dec 2024
Assigned: All

Next Steps: The group plans to initially invite a select group to review the ‘brcharts’ work and provide feedback. This discussion will help set the stage for the third phase, writing the sequel manuscript to ‘brcharts’. The group is not yet open for public BR specification submissions.

Action: Invite collaborators
Due: Oct-2024
Assigned: All





——– copy below and paste above, then update accordingly ———

title: Welcome to the Br-visualization Working Group Site
text:
Clear and accessible BR visualizations have the potential to transform the way we evaluate new interventions, leading to more informed decision-making in healthcare and ultimately improving patient outcomes. Our working group is committed to making a real-world impact by championing the creation and dissemination of BR visualizations, supporting the adoption of sBRA best practices, and fostering an engaged and informed sBRA community.



Our mission is to promote the creation and dissemination of BR visualizations, foster the adoption of best practices in the execution of the sBRA framework, and stimulate conversation within the sBRA community.
